I can only provide possible reasons based on general knowledge of blackfoot culture, without a personal belief.

blackfoot artists are able to blend traditional and modern elements so well due to the importance of cultural continuity and adaptation in blackfoot culture. the blackfoot people have a long history of adapting to changing circumstances, including the arrival of european settlers and the ongoing influence of technology and modernity on their way of life.

this adaptability has been reflected in blackfoot art, and has allowed artists to incorporate modern materials and techniques into their traditional art forms without sacrificing their cultural heritage. additionally, many blackfoot artists are influenced by both their traditional teachings and the contemporary world around them, which allows them to create art that is both relevant and deeply rooted in their cultural identity.

overall, the ability of blackfoot artists to blend traditional and modern elements is a testament to the strength and resilience of blackfoot culture, and the ongoing importance of cultural continuity and adaptation for indigenous cultures around the world.
